ChangeLog.GeneralNotes:
» Uploaded the latest build exe to GitHub and updated the manifest. 
» Updated the Wiki with information for the new build. 
» Added additional formatting to the Wiki and the Readme to help the flow of each document and aide in readability.
ChangeLog.NewFeatures:
» Redesigned the Preset Manager in the Latency Monitor feature to be easier to navigate and flow better when creating a new Preset. 
» Added message popups for when a report has been generated and added logic to open the Windows File Explorer to the Reports directory following successful creation of a report. 
» Changed the DateTime Calendar Picker used in several spots within the Network Analyzer to preselect Today's Date on load as well as populate the hours, minutes and seconds fields with the current time.
ChangeLog.BugFixes:
» Fixed a bug where the Report Explorer was unable to generate Latency Monitor reports if the Date Range option was selected. 
» Fixed a bug where certain filter types in the Latency Monitor would not calculate their operators correctly (i.e. setting the filter to CurrentLatency < 10 would not correctly restrict the results to items with a CurrentLatency under 10). 
» Fixed a bug where several different SQL queries were not properly comparing Timestamps.

ChangeLog.GeneralNotes:
» Merged the UI and Data branch into the main branch to finalize all new changes. 
» Uploaded the latest build exe to GitHub and updated the manifest. 
» Updated the Wiki with information for the new build
ChangeLog.NewFeatures:
» Complete UI overhaul which removed the split on the Latency Monitor, allowing for both targeted monitoring and traceroute monitoring. 
» Introduced a history pane in the Latency Monitor to allow for reviewing of data in the current Latency Monitor session and filtering of said data for specific criteria. The history pane also includes selective columns, allowing for viewing only the data you care about. 
» Added the ability to resize the window as part of the UI overhaul, in an attempt to make the UI more responsive and easier to use for a variety of display sizes. 
» Introduced a new settings pane to allow for centralized management of all user-definable settings in the entire app. 
» Revamped the data being generated by the Latency Monitor to allow for tracking all packets, not just those which were logged via an arbitrary status indicator. 
» Moved Latency Monitor multi-target definition to the Preset Manager with the introduction of QuickStart if only a single address is needed.
ChangeLog.BugFixes:
» Fixed a bug where the Latency Monitor would fail on certain IP Addresses due to being unable to perform a reverse DNS lookup. 
» Fixed a bug where the IP Scanner would fail to scan anything larger than a /24 subnet due to not correctly handling the CIDR notation and subnet mask.

ChangeLog.GeneralNotes: » Uploaded the latest build exe to GitHub.
ChangeLog.BugFixes:
» Fixed a bug where the IP Scanner would hang on certain IP Addresses during a scan and never complete the scan.
» Fixed a bug where certain IP Addresses entered into the Latency Monitor, which didn't have a DNS record would associated with them, would cause the application to crash as soon as DNS resolution was attempted.

ChangeLog.GeneralNotes:
» Uploaded the latest build exe to GitHub.
» Moved the Status Bar for the Latency Monitor to the bottom of the window to match the new design for the IP Scanner.
» Updated the Latency Monitor Traceroute mode and the IP Scanner to display the results of their scan live instead of all at once upon completion.
» Updated the scan duration for the IP Scanner to be live rather than displayed upon completion.
» Moved the ReadMe information to the Wiki on the GitHub repository.
ChangeLog.NewFeatures:
» Added the Profile Manager for the Latency Monitor to store commonly used targets, which persist between app instances.
» Added the Status Bar for the IP Scanner to display the total number of scannable IPs, total active IPs and total inactive IPs.
» Added the Report Manager to allow for managing report data in one centralized location for all features.
» Added the option to generate each report type as a CSV along with the HTML format.
» Added a local SQLite database to provide redundancy and prevent data loss in the case of the app closing prior to the monitoring session completing successfully. Note: The data stored in the database is only for local redundancy and does not report back to anywhere outside of the device running the application.
» Added logging to help track crashes and better troubleshoot issues.
ChangeLog.BugFixes:
» Fixed a bug where the Average Latency in the Latency Monitor wasn't being calculated correctly.
» Fixed a bug where the Latency Monitor Status wasn't accurately representing the status of the target when the target wasn't active in Traceroute Mode.
» (GitHub Issue #2) Fixed a bug (hopefully) where the Network Analyzer would crash due to mishandling the available ephemeral ports on a device.

ChangeLog.GeneralNotes:
» Uploaded the latest build exe to GitHub.
» Added icons in various places for better UI usability.
» Removed the Latency Monitor's Simple mode in favor of one condensed User Targets mode.
» Added a FINALIZING status to the Latency Monitor to inform the user when the current session is wrapping up.
» Configured the main controls for each feature to be more clear when they are disabled.
ChangeLog.NewFeatures:
» Implemented the Latency Monitor Traceroute mode.
» Revamped the HTML report generated from the Latency Monitor to be more readable and support both the User Targets mode and Traceroute mode.
» Added a system tray icon which can be used to hide the Network Analyzer window while it is actively running.
» Added a connectivity monitor to the Home screen to inform the user of the computer's current IPv4, IPv6 and DNS status.
ChangeLog.BugFixes: » Fixed a bug where the UI was not being properly reset between sessions.

ChangeLog.GeneralNotes: » Migrated the NetworkAnalyzer project to GitHub.
ChangeLog.NewFeatures:
» Implemented the IP Scanner feature.
» Added a new Light Mode and placed the toggle for switching themes at the top of the window.
» Added functionality to check for new versions of the app and provide a download link to access the new version.
» Added additional information to the Home Screen to aid in gathering device info.
ChangeLog.BugFixes: » Fixed various issues which were causing the application to lag while performing either scan.

ChangeLog.GeneralNotes:
» Updated the executable stored in Azure. (Be sure to download the latest version if you aren't running it.)
» Removed the button for the Port Scanner as this feature is now planned to be apart of the IP Scanner feature, coming in a future update.
ChangeLog.BugFixes:
» Fixed an issue where running multiple Latency Monitor tests back to back without closing the application would cause the test results to be stored incorrectly and not show up on the reports as intended.
» Added an additional step to the Latency Monitor testing process to ensure previous testing data is cleared out when starting a new test.
» Tweaked the HTML Report template's formatting to be easier to read and have less unnecessary white space in the sections storing the Latency Monitor test results.

ChangeLog.GeneralNotes: » Updated the executable stored in Azure. (Be sure to download the latest version if you aren't running it.)
ChangeLog.NewFeatures:
» Updated the User Interface to include an easily navigable menu for current and future features.
» Updated the color scheme of the User Interface to be easier to read.
» Added a 'Home' button to include the changelog for the latest version without the need to review documentation.
» Recreated the Latency Monitor functionality on the backend to allow for better handling of the collected data.
» Removed the feature that auto-created a CSV file while the Latency Monitor was running and replaced it with a HTML report that better identifies the targets used during the test and results from those targets.
ChangeLog.BugFixes:
» Added additional checks to the way IP Addresses are validated to accomodate IP Addresses that meet all other requirements but don't resolve to a host.
» Fixed an issue where the application would be unintentionally closed while the Latency Monitor is actively running.
» Changed the way the application pauses between runs of the Latency Monitor that was causing the application to be extremely laggy during normal operation.

ChangeLog.GeneralNotes: » Updated the executable stored in Azure. (If you already have a copy of the application downloaded, make sure to download a new copy that matches the latest version number shown at the top of this document.)
ChangeLog.NewFeatures:
» Previous test results now clear from the form upon starting a new test.
» The buttons now change color upon hovering over them so it is better known when they are active.
ChangeLog.BugFixes:
» Corrected the way the CSV file is created. It now generates the CSV file once per test and stopping/starting the test creates a new CSV file with data from the new test.
» Updated the user input validation to account for IP Addresses that cannot resolve a DNS name (i.e. firewall addresses)
» Set the Start button to be disabled upon starting a test to prevent additional tests from inadvertently being started simultaneously.
